p: 11. No. 3: any ex-sistentiel-personal world of meaning. A world of meaning—an exclusively human phenomenon— is ontic (it is a thing), but it is an ex-sistentiel thing, something that only persons live in. Such an ontic-ex-sistentiel world can be private (e.g., your family, a specific set of interests you have, etc.) or social (the communities— economic, political, and so on—that you inhabit.
